Letter not found. Item is a register entry onlyfor an itemdated 2 February 1885and registered on 3 February.
[Alteration in classification re Mr French necessary. Suggests that all employés in his Dept be styled "clerical"]
M's letter was returned to him on 5 February 1885 minuted: 'Attach copy of your letter of 7.6.84'(letter not found).Mcomplied on 6 February and the letters were forwarded to the Public Service Board on 9 February with the annotation: 'For consideration'.
It is unclear whether the register entry refers toCharles FrenchSnror his sonCharles H. French; both were employed in M's department.It is more likely to haveconcerned theolder French, who had been appointed from 1 March 1884;see T. Wilson to M, 14 March 1884(in this edition as 84-03-14b).
The request was evidently unsuccessful; M to A. Deakin,30 March 1889,was another attempt to have thestaff reclassified, but the secretary of the Public Service Board reported that to be appointed to the clerical division would require the officers to pass the relevant examination, andthenbe appointed at a level with a lower salary than they already had.
